[ ]()

## Visit the ISAC Museum 

Since our founding in 1919, ISAC has been a leading research center for the study of ancient civilizations. With some 350,000 artifacts, excavated mainly by ISAC archaeologists, the ISAC Museum invites you to learn about the beginnings of our lives as humans together. Through galleries devoted to Egypt, Nubia, Persia, Mesopotamia, Syria, Anatolia, and the Levant, come take a look into the ancient past. To learn more about our collections, browse the [Museum Galleries and Exhibits](/museum-exhibits) and [Collections](https://isac-idb.uchicago.edu) sections of this website. For more information including accessibility, browse the menu tabs.

**[Click Here for Visitor Information](https://isac.uchicago.edu/visit/visit-museum)**

## News

[ ](/article/naomi-harris-translates-hittite-poems-paris-review)

### [Naomi Harris translates Hittite poems for The Paris Review](/article/naomi-harris-translates-hittite-poems-paris-review)

As reported by the Division of the Arts & Humanities and UChicago News, translations of ancient Hittite poems by PhD student Naomi Harris have been published in The Paris Review Issue no. 253 (Fall 2025). 

Posted on Thu, ...
